The drop in oleiculture, which started around 1100 BCE ( Fig. 3C), may result not only from the decline of agricultural practices but also from a change in the phenology of the olive trees because of climate pressures. Although the olive tree is a parsimonious water consumer that is well adapted to xeric conditions, water stress can affect flowering, resulting in low pollen production (
